headline.print_headline: Report Cites Bias by Police In Killings In Canada
headline.seo: Report Cites Bias by Police In Killings In Canada
headline.main: Report Cites Bias by Police in Killings in Canada

docs.snippet: A pig farmer managed to murder 49 women before his arrest in 2002 largely because of “systemic bias by the police” against the victims, many of whom were from aboriginal groups, an inquiry has found....
docs.abstract: Report issued by Canadian inquiry into 49 murders committed by Robert W Pickton in Vancouver in 1990s finds that Pickton was able to continue his killing spree largely because of systemic bias by police against victims, many of whom were women from aboriginal groups.
docs.lead_paragraph: A pig farmer managed to murder 49 women before his arrest in 2002 largely because of “systemic bias by the police” against the victims, many of whom were from aboriginal groups, an inquiry has found.

headline.print_headline: New Forms of Assistance Benefit Homeowners in Storm-Torn Areas
headline.seo: New Forms of U.S. Aid Benefit Homeowners in Storm-Damaged Areas
headline.main: New Forms of Assistance Benefit Homeowners in Storm-Torn Areas

docs.snippet: Innovative steps have accelerated repairs on damaged homes and apartment buildings in an area with a shortage of vacant housing and a lack of open space for trailers....
docs.abstract: New York and New Jersey homeowners hit hard by Hurricane Sandy are receiving an unusually generous array of federal financial assistance, including $131 million in expedited rental assistance; Federal Emergency Management Agency officials report they are taking innovative steps to accelerate repairs on damaged homes in areas with a shortage of vacant housing; highlights of assistance charted.

byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON and WINNIE HU

docs.lead_paragraph: Innovative steps have accelerated repairs on damaged homes and apartment buildings in an area with a shortage of vacant housing and a lack of open space for trailers.

headline.print_headline: In Colorado, Getting Down To Business of Marijuana
headline.seo: Task Force Created to Regulate Legalized Marijuana in Colorado
headline.main: In Colorado, Getting Down to Business of Marijuana

docs.snippet: Six weeks after voters made Colorado one of two states to legalize the recreational use of marijuana, a task force started to determine how the state will regulate its use....
docs.abstract: Task force is started to determine how Colorado will regulate marijuana use six weeks after voters made it one of two states to legalize recreational use;  array of state officers as well as various marijuana advocates will weigh in on issues such as identification of revenue sources and prospect of federal government cracking down on the drug.
docs.lead_paragraph: Six weeks after voters made Colorado one of two states to legalize the recreational use of marijuana, a task force started to determine how the state will regulate its use.

headline.print_headline: Misfiring Williams Takes Shot at the Nets’ System
headline.seo: Misfiring Deron Williams Takes Shot at the Nets’ System
headline.main: Misfiring Williams Takes Shot at the Nets’ System

docs.snippet: Deron Williams, who is is averaging 17 points and 8.3 assists while shooting 38.8 percent from the field, said the offense he ran in Utah was a better fit for him than the Nets’ system....
docs.abstract: Brooklyn Nets guard Deron Williams says offense he ran with Utah Jazz in 2011 is better fit for him than Nets' system; Nets are preparing for upcoming game against the Jazz in Brooklyn.
docs.lead_paragraph: Deron Williams, who is is averaging 17 points and 8.3 assists while shooting 38.8 percent from the field, said the offense he ran in Utah was a better fit for him than the Nets’ system.

headline.print_headline: Silent Since Shootings, N.R.A. Could Face Challenge to Political Power
headline.seo: Silent Since Shootings, N.R.A. Could Face Challenge to Political Power
headline.main: Silent Since Shootings, N.R.A. Could Face Challenge to Political Power

docs.snippet: The Newtown tragedy may provide the National Rifle Association with its first genuine test in years....
docs.abstract: National Rifle Association has remained silent after the second-deadliest school shooting in United States history in Newtown, Conn, but it still wields one of the biggest sticks in politics, with a $300 million budget, millions of members around the country and virtually unmatched ferocity in advancing its political and legislative interests; some opponents speculate that Newtown shooting may provide the NRA with first genuine test of its political power in over a decade.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE, MICHAEL COOPER and MICHAEL LUO

docs.lead_paragraph: The Newtown tragedy may provide the National Rifle Association with its first genuine test in years.

headline.print_headline: A Pristine Afghan Prison Faces a Murky Future
headline.seo: A Pristine Afghan Prison Faces a Murky Future
headline.main: A Pristine Afghan Prison Faces a Murky Future

docs.snippet: There is no doubt that Helmand Central Prison in Afghanistan is impressive, but the only question is how long it will stay that way once Western forces leave and Western money dwindles....
docs.abstract: Lashkar Gah Journal; Helmand Central Prison in Lashkar Gah, Afghanistan, is impressive modern facility that is clean and well-maintained, offering array of services to inmates, but question is how long it will stay that way once Western forces leave and Western money dwindles.
docs.lead_paragraph: There is no doubt that Helmand Central Prison in Afghanistan is impressive, but the only question is how long it will stay that way once Western forces leave and Western money dwindles.

headline.print_headline: Pro-Gun Democrats Signaling Openness to Limits; Town Starts the Mournful Task of Saying Goodbye
headline.seo: Pro-Gun Democrats Signal Openness to Limits
headline.main: Pro-Gun Democrats Signaling Openness to Limits

docs.snippet: In the aftermath of the Connecticut school killings, momentum was building on Capitol Hill for tightening controls over firearms....
docs.abstract: Several pro-gun Democrats in Congress signal openness to new gun restrictions in wake of Newtown, Conn, school massacre; are joining fellow Democrats who hope to seize on outrage and despondency from national tragedy to build coalition of lawmakers who might be able to create some form of compromise limits on gun sales or types.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and CHARLIE SAVAGE

docs.lead_paragraph: In the aftermath of the Connecticut school killings, momentum was building on Capitol Hill for tightening controls over firearms.

docs.snippet: Corrections appearing in print on December 18, 2012....
docs.lead_paragraph: Corrections appearing in print on December 18, 2012.

headline.print_headline: Unable to Lock Up Dickey, Mets Capitalize on Value
headline.seo: Mets, Unable to Lock Up Dickey, Capitalize on Value With Trade
headline.main: Unable to Lock Up Dickey, Mets Capitalize on Value

docs.snippet: R. A. Dickey’s value turned out to be worth two of the Blue Jays’ top prospects, Travis d’Arnaud, a 23-year-old catcher, and the 20-year-old right-hander Noah Syndergaard....
docs.abstract: New York Mets trade pitcher R A Dickey to Toronto Blue Jays in exchange for catcher Travis d'Arnaud and pitcher Noah Syndergaard, two of Blue Jays top prospects.
docs.lead_paragraph: R. A. Dickey’s value turned out to be worth two of the Blue Jays’ top prospects, Travis d’Arnaud, a 23-year-old catcher, and the 20-year-old right-hander Noah Syndergaard.

headline.print_headline: Seeking Comfort in Song Amid the Whiz of Bullets
headline.seo: Amid the Whiz of Bullets, Seeking Comfort in Song
headline.main: Seeking Comfort in Song Amid the Whiz of Bullets

docs.snippet: From school officials, parents and police, a clearer picture is emerging of the scene inside the school; to keep children calm, some teachers sang songs, others handed out lollipops....
docs.abstract: Scene inside Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn, after gunman Adam Lanza began firing is pieced together from numerous interviews with school officials, police and parents; authorities reveal that Lanza had hundreds of unspent rounds, raising the prospect that had he not killed himself as the police approached, the number of victims could have been far higher than 26.

byline.original: By SAM DOLNICK and MICHAEL WILSON

docs.lead_paragraph: From school officials, parents and police, a clearer picture is emerging of the scene inside the school; to keep children calm, some teachers sang songs, others handed out lollipops.
